add_address_to_env.description: If true, adds the value of the `address` argument to the Terraform process environment.

address.description: URL of the root of the target Vault server.

ca_cert_dir.description: Path to directory containing CA certificate files to validate the server's certificate.

ca_cert_file.description: Path to a CA certificate file to validate the server's certificate.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Maximum TTL for secret leases requested by this provider

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries when a 5xx error code is encountered.

namespace.description: The namespace to use. Available only for Vault Enterprise

skip_tls_verify.description: Set this to true only if the target Vault server is an insecure development instance.

token.description: Token to use to authenticate to Vault.

token_name.description: Token name to use for creating the Vault child token.

cert_file.description: Path to a file containing the client certificate.

key_file.description: Path to a file containing the private key that the certificate was issued for.

backend.description: Auth backend.

role.description: Name of the role. Must correspond with the name of the role reflected in the arn.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

lease_duration.description: How long the token is valid for.

lease_started.description: The timestamp the lease started on, as determined by the machine running Terraform.

renewable.description: Whether the token is renewable or not.

role_id.description: The RoleID to log in with.

secret_id.description: The SecretID to log in with.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bind_secret_id.description: Whether or not to require secret_id to be present when logging in using this AppRole.

bound_cidr_list.description: List of CIDR blocks that can log in using the AppRole.

period.description: Number of seconds to set the TTL to for issued tokens upon renewal. Makes the token a periodic token, which will never expire as long as it is renewed before the TTL each period.

policies.description: Policies to be set on tokens issued using this AppRole.

role_id.description: The RoleID of the role. Autogenerated if not set.

secret_id_bound_cidrs.description: List of CIDR blocks that can log in using the AppRole.

secret_id_num_uses.description: Number of times which a particular SecretID can be used to fetch a token from this AppRole, after which the SecretID will expire. Leaving this unset or setting it to 0 will allow unlimited uses.

secret_id_ttl.description: Number of seconds a SecretID remains valid for.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

accessor.description: The unique ID used to access this SecretID.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

cidr_list.description: List of CIDR blocks that can log in using the SecretID.

secret_id.description: The SecretID to be managed. If not specified, Vault auto-generates one.

wrapping_ttl.description: The TTL duration of the wrapped SecretID.

description.description: Human-friendly description of the audit device

options.description: Configuration options to pass to the audit device itself

path.description: Path in which to enable the audit device

type.description: Type of the audit device, such as 'file'

accessor.description: The accessor of the auth backend

description.description: The description of the auth backend

listing_visibility.description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint

local.description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

max_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Maximum possible lease duration in seconds

path.description: path to mount the backend. This defaults to the type.

aws_public_cert.description: Base64 encoded AWS Public key required to verify PKCS7 signature of the EC2 instance metadata.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

cert_name.description: Name of the certificate to configure.

type.description: The type of document that can be verified using the certificate. Must be either "pkcs7" or "identity".

access_key.description: AWS Access key with permissions to query AWS APIs.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

ec2_endpoint.description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS EC2 API calls.

iam_endpoint.description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS IAM API calls.

iam_server_id_header_value.description: The value to require in the X-Vault-AWS-IAM-Server-ID header as part of GetCallerIdentity requests that are used in the iam auth method.

secret_key.description: AWS Secret key with permissions to query AWS APIs.

sts_endpoint.description: URL to override the default generated endpoint for making AWS STS API calls.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

disable_periodic_tidy.description: If true, disables the periodic tidying of the identiy whitelist entries.

safety_buffer.description: The amount of extra time that must have passed beyond the roletag expiration, before it's removed from backend storage.

accessor.description: The accessor returned from Vault for this token.

auth_type.description: The auth method used to generate this token.

backend.description: AWS Auth Backend to read the token from.

iam_http_request_method.description: The HTTP method used in the signed request.

iam_request_body.description: The Base64-encoded body of the signed request.

iam_request_headers.description: The Base64-encoded, JSON serialized representation of the sts:GetCallerIdentity HTTP request headers.

iam_request_url.description: The Base64-encoded HTTP URL used in the signed request.

identity.description: Base64-encoded EC2 instance identity document to authenticate with.

lease_duration.description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_start_time.description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

metadata.description: The metadata reported by the Vault server.

nonce.description: The nonce to be used for subsequent login requests.

pkcs7.description: PKCS7 signature of the identity document to authenticate with, with all newline characters removed.

policies.description: The policies assigned to this token.

renewable.description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

role.description: AWS Auth Role to read the token from.

signature.description: Base64-encoded SHA256 RSA signature of the instance identtiy document to authenticate with.

allow_instance_migration.description: When true, allows migration of the underlying instance where the client resides. Use with caution.

auth_type.description: The auth type permitted for this role.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bound_account_id.description: Only EC2 instances with this account ID in their identity document will be permitted to log in.

bound_account_ids.description: Only EC2 instances with this account ID in their identity document will be permitted to log in.

bound_ami_id.description: Only EC2 instances using this AMI ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_ami_ids.description: Only EC2 instances using this AMI ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_ec2_instance_id.description: Only EC2 instances that match this instance ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_ec2_instance_ids.description: Only EC2 instances that match this instance ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_instance_profile_arn.description: Only EC2 instances associated with an IAM instance profile ARN that matches this value will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_instance_profile_arns.description: Only EC2 instances associated with an IAM instance profile ARN that matches this value will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_principal_arn.description: The IAM principal that must be authenticated using the iam auth method.

bound_iam_principal_arns.description: The IAM principal that must be authenticated using the iam auth method.

bound_iam_role_arn.description: Only EC2 instances that match this IAM role ARN will be permitted to log in.

bound_iam_role_arns.description: Only EC2 instances that match this IAM role ARN will be permitted to log in.

bound_region.description: Only EC2 instances in this region will be permitted to log in.

bound_regions.description: Only EC2 instances in this region will be permitted to log in.

bound_subnet_id.description: Only EC2 instances associated with this subnet ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_subnet_ids.description: Only EC2 instances associated with this subnet ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_vpc_id.description: Only EC2 instances associated with this VPC ID will be permitted to log in.

bound_vpc_ids.description: Only EC2 instances associated with this VPC ID will be permitted to log in.

disallow_reauthentication.description: When true, only allows a single token to be granted per instance ID.

inferred_aws_region.description: The region to search for the inferred entities in.

inferred_entity_type.description: The type of inferencing Vault should do.

max_ttl.description: The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role, provided as the number of seconds.

period.description: If set, indicates that the token generated using this role should never expire. The token should be renewed within the duration specified by this value. At each renewal, the token's TTL will be set to the value of this field. The maximum allowed lifetime of token issued using this role. Specified as a number of seconds.

policies.description: Policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

resolve_aws_unique_ids.description: Whether or not Vault should resolve the bound_iam_principal_arn to an AWS Unique ID. When true, deleting a principal and recreating it with the same name won't automatically grant the new principal the same roles in Vault that the old principal had.

role_tag.description: The key of the tag on EC2 instance to use for role tags.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

ttl.description: The TTL period of tokens issued using this role, provided as the number of seconds.

allow_instance_migration.description: Allows migration of the underlying instance where the client resides.

backend.description: AWS auth backend to read tags from.

disallow_reauthentication.description: Only allow a single token to be granted per instance ID.

instance_id.description: Instance ID for which this tag is intended. The created tag can only be used by the instance with the given ID.

max_ttl.description: The maximum allowed lifetime of tokens issued using this role.

policies.description: Policies to be associated with the tag.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

disable_periodic_tidy.description: If true, disables the periodic tidying of the roletag blacklist entries.

safety_buffer.description: The amount of extra time that must have passed beyond the roletag expiration, before it's removed from backend storage.

account_id.description: AWS account ID to be associated with STS role.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

sts_role.description: AWS ARN for STS role to be assumed when interacting with the account specified.

access_key.description: The AWS Access Key ID to use when generating new credentials.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Default lease duration for secrets in seconds

description.description: Human-friendly description of the mount for the backend.

max_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Maximum possible lease duration for secrets in seconds

path.description: Path to mount the backend at.

region.description: The AWS region to make API calls against. Defaults to us-east-1.

secret_key.description: The AWS Secret Access Key to use when generating new credentials.

backend.description: The path of the AWS Secret Backend the role belongs to.

default_sts_ttl.description: The default TTL in seconds for STS credentials. When a TTL is not specified when STS credentials are requested, and a default TTL is specified on the role, then this default TTL will be used. Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.

iam_groups.description: A list of IAM group names. IAM users generated against this vault role will be added to these IAM Groups. For a credential type of assumed_role or federation_token, the policies sent to the corresponding AWS call (sts:AssumeRole or sts:GetFederation) will be the policies from each group in iam_groups combined with the policy_document and policy_arns parameters.

max_sts_ttl.description: The max allowed TTL in seconds for STS credentials (credentials TTL are capped to max_sts_ttl). Valid only when credential_type is one of assumed_role or federation_token.

policy.description: IAM policy the role should use in JSON format.

policy_arn.description: ARN for an existing IAM policy the role should use.

policy_arns.description: ARN for an existing IAM policy the role should use.

policy_document.description: IAM policy the role should use in JSON format.

role_arns.description: ARNs of AWS roles allowed to be assumed. Only valid when credential_type is 'assumed_role'

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

client_secret.description: The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs

tenant_id.description: The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory organization.

canonical_id.description: ID of the group to which this is an alias.

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs to.

exclusive.description: Should the resource manage member entity ids exclusively? Beware of race conditions when disabling exclusive management

member_entity_ids.description: Entity IDs to be assigned as group members.

exclusive.description: Should the resource manage policies exclusively? Beware of race conditions when disabling exclusive management

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the group.

issuer.description: Issuer URL to be used in the iss claim of the token. If not set, Vault's api_addr will be used. The issuer is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host, and optionally, port number and path components, but no query or fragment components.

algorithm.description: Signing algorithm to use. Signing algorithm to use. Allowed values are: RS256 (default), RS384, RS512, ES256, ES384, ES512, EdDSA.

allowed_client_ids.description: Array of role client ids allowed to use this key for signing. If empty, no roles are allowed. If "*", all roles are allowed.

rotation_period.description: How often to generate a new signing key in number of seconds

verification_ttl.description: Controls how long the public portion of a signing key will be available for verification after being rotated in seconds.

allowed_client_id.description: Role Client ID allowed to use the key for signing.

client_id.description: The value that will be included in the `aud` field of all the OIDC identity tokens issued by this role

key.description: A configured named key, the key must already exist.

template.description: The template string to use for generating tokens. This may be in string-ified JSON or base64 format.

ttl.description: TTL of the tokens generated against the role in number of seconds.

accessor.description: The accessor of the JWT auth backend

bound_issuer.description: The value against which to match the iss claim in a JWT

default_role.description: The default role to use if none is provided during login

description.description: The description of the auth backend

jwks_ca_pem.description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the JWKS URL. If not set, system certificates are used.

jwks_url.description: JWKS URL to use to authenticate signatures. Cannot be used with 'oidc_discovery_url' or 'jwt_validation_pubkeys'.

jwt_supported_algs.description: A list of supported signing algorithms. Defaults to [RS256]

jwt_validation_pubkeys.description: A list of PEM-encoded public keys to use to authenticate signatures locally. Cannot be used with 'jwks_url' or 'oidc_discovery_url'.

oidc_discovery_ca_pem.description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the OIDC Discovery URL. If not set, system certificates are used

oidc_discovery_url.description: The OIDC Discovery URL, without any .well-known component (base path). Cannot be used with 'jwks_url' or 'jwt_validation_pubkeys'.

path.description: path to mount the backend

type.description: Type of backend. Can be either 'jwt' or 'oidc'

allowed_redirect_uris.description: The list of allowed values for redirect_uri during OIDC logins.

backend.description: Unique name of the auth backend to configure.

bound_audiences.description: List of aud claims to match against. Any match is sufficient.

bound_cidrs.description: List of CIDRs valid as the source address for login requests. This value is also encoded into any resulting token.

bound_claims.description: Map of claims/values to match against. The expected value may be a single string or a comma-separated string list.

bound_subject.description: If set, requires that the sub claim matches this value.

claim_mappings.description: Map of claims (keys) to be copied to specified metadata fields (values).

clock_skew_leeway.description: The amount of leeway to add to all claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 60 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

expiration_leeway.description: The amount of leeway to add to expiration (exp) claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 60 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

groups_claim.description: The claim to use to uniquely identify the set of groups to which the user belongs; this will be used as the names for the Identity group aliases created due to a successful login. The claim value must be a list of strings.

groups_claim_delimiter_pattern.description: A pattern of delimiters used to allow the groups_claim to live outside of the top-level JWT structure. For instance, a groups_claim of meta/user.name/groups with this field set to // will expect nested structures named meta, user.name, and groups. If this field was set to /./ the groups information would expect to be via nested structures of meta, user, name, and groups.

max_ttl.description: Number of seconds after which issued tokens can no longer be renewed.

not_before_leeway.description: The amount of leeway to add to not before (nbf) claims to account for clock skew, in seconds. Defaults to 150 seconds if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1. Only applicable with 'jwt' roles.

num_uses.description: Number of times issued tokens can be used. Setting this to 0 or leaving it unset means unlimited uses.

oidc_scopes.description: List of OIDC scopes to be used with an OIDC role. The standard scope "openid" is automatically included and need not be specified.

period.description: Number of seconds to set the TTL to for issued tokens upon renewal. Makes the token a periodic token, which will never expire as long as it is renewed before the TTL each period.

policies.description: Policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

ttl.description: Default number of seconds to set as the TTL for issued tokens and at renewal time.

user_claim.description: The claim to use to uniquely identify the user; this will be used as the name for the Identity entity alias created due to a successful login.

verbose_oidc_logging.description: Log received OIDC tokens and claims when debug-level logging is active. Not recommended in production since sensitive information may be present in OIDC responses.

backend.description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

issuer.description: Optional JWT issuer. If no issuer is specified, kubernetes.io/serviceaccount will be used as the default issuer.

kubernetes_ca_cert.description: PEM encoded CA cert for use by the TLS client used to talk with the Kubernetes API.

kubernetes_host.description: Host must be a host string, a host:port pair, or a URL to the base of the Kubernetes API server.

pem_keys.description: Optional list of PEM-formatted public keys or certificates used to verify the signatures of Kubernetes service account JWTs. If a certificate is given, its public key will be extracted. Not every installation of Kubernetes exposes these keys.

token_reviewer_jwt.description: A service account JWT used to access the TokenReview API to validate other JWTs during login. If not set the JWT used for login will be used to access the API.

audience.description: Optional Audience claim to verify in the JWT.

backend.description: Unique name of the kubernetes backend to configure.

bound_cidrs.description: List of CIDRs valid as the source address for login requests. This value is also encoded into any resulting token.

bound_service_account_names.description: List of service account names able to access this role. If set to `["*"]` all names are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_namespaces can not be "*".

bound_service_account_namespaces.description: List of namespaces allowed to access this role. If set to `["*"]` all namespaces are allowed, both this and bound_service_account_names can not be set to "*".

max_ttl.description: Number of seconds after which issued tokens can no longer be renewed.

num_uses.description: Number of times issued tokens can be used. Setting this to 0 or leaving it unset means unlimited uses.

period.description: Number of seconds to set the TTL to for issued tokens upon renewal. Makes the token a periodic token, which will never expire as long as it is renewed before the TTL each period.

policies.description: Policies to be set on tokens issued using this role.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: Generated Token's Explicit Maximum TTL in seconds

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

ttl.description: Default number of seconds to set as the TTL for issued tokens and at renewal time.

accessor.description: The accessor of the LDAP auth backend

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate in seconds

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

mount_accessor.description: The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

username_format.description: A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to substitute should be placed in `{{}}`.

default_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Default lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

external_entropy_access.description: Enable the secrets engine to access Vault's external entropy source

local.description: Local mount flag that can be explicitly set to true to enforce local mount in HA environment

max_lease_ttl_seconds.description: Maximum possible lease duration for tokens and secrets in seconds

options.description: Specifies mount type specific options that are passed to the backend

path.description: Where the secret backend will be mounted

seal_wrap.description: Enable seal wrapping for the mount, causing values stored by the mount to be wrapped by the seal's encryption capability

type.description: Type of the backend, such as 'aws'

path.description: Path of the namespace.

accessor.description: The mount accessor related to the auth mount.

base_url.description: The Okta url. Examples: oktapreview.com, okta.com (default)

bypass_okta_mfa.description: When true, requests by Okta for a MFA check will be bypassed. This also disallows certain status checks on the account, such as whether the password is expired.

description.description: The description of the auth backend

max_ttl.description: Maximum duration after which authentication will be expired

organization.description: The Okta organization. This will be the first part of the url https://XXX.okta.com.

path.description: path to mount the backend

token.description: The Okta API token. This is required to query Okta for user group membership. If this is not supplied only locally configured groups will be enabled.

ttl.description: Duration after which authentication will be expired

path.description: Path to the Okta auth backend

policies.description: Policies to associate with this group

groups.description: Groups within the Okta auth backend to associate with this user

path.description: Path to the Okta auth backend

policies.description: Policies to associate with this user

username.description: Name of the user within Okta

allow_bare_domains.description: Flag to allow certificates matching the actual domain.

allow_glob_domains.description: Flag to allow names containing glob patterns.

allow_localhost.description: Flag to allow certificates for localhost.

allow_subdomains.description: Flag to allow certificates matching subdomains.

backend.description: The path of the PKI secret backend the resource belongs to.

basic_constraints_valid_for_non_ca.description: Flag to mark basic constraints valid when issuing non-CA certificates.

client_flag.description: Flag to specify certificates for client use.

code_signing_flag.description: Flag to specify certificates for code signing use.

email_protection_flag.description: Flag to specify certificates for email protection use.

enforce_hostnames.description: Flag to allow only valid host names

ext_key_usage.description: Specify the allowed extended key usage constraint on issued certificates.

generate_lease.description: Flag to generate leases with certificates.

key_bits.description: The number of bits of generated keys.

key_usage.description: Specify the allowed key usage constraint on issued certificates.

no_store.description: Flag to not store certificates in the storage backend.

not_before_duration.description: Specifies the duration by which to backdate the NotBefore property.

ou.description: The organization unit of generated certificates.

policy_identifiers.description: Specify the list of allowed policies IODs.

postal_code.description: The postal code of generated certificates.

server_flag.description: Flag to specify certificates for server use.

street_address.description: The street address of generated certificates.

use_csr_common_name.description: Flag to use the CN in the CSR.

use_csr_sans.description: Flag to use the SANs in the CSR.

max_path_length.description: The maximum path length to encode in the generated certificate.

permitted_dns_domains.description: List of domains for which certificates are allowed to be issued.

rate.description: The maximum number of requests at any given second to be allowed by the quota rule. The rate must be positive.

password.description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator password

path.description: The path of the RabbitMQ Secret Backend where the connection should be configured

username.description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator username

verify_connection.description: Specifies whether to verify connection URI, username, and password.

backend.description: The path of the Rabbitmq Secret Backend the role belongs to.

tags.description: Specifies a comma-separated RabbitMQ management tags.

configure.description: The configure permissions for this vhost.

host.description: The vhost to set permissions for.

read.description: The read permissions for this vhost.

write.description: The write permissions for this vhost.

enforcement_level.description: Enforcement level of Sentinel policy. Can be one of: 'advisory', 'soft-mandatory' or 'hard-mandatory'

backend.description: The path of the SSH Secret Backend where the CA should be configured

generate_signing_key.description: Whether Vault should generate the signing key pair internally.

private_key.description: Private key part the SSH CA key pair; required if generate_signing_key is false.

public_key.description: Public key part the SSH CA key pair; required if generate_signing_key is false.

display_name.description: The display name of the token.

encrypted_client_token.description: The client token encrypted using the provided PGP key.

explicit_max_ttl.description: The explicit max TTL of the token.

no_default_policy.description: Flag to disable the default policy.

no_parent.description: Flag to create a token without parent.

num_uses.description: The number of allowed uses of the token.

pgp_key.description: The PGP key (base64 encoded) to encrypt the token.

renew_min_lease.description: The minimum lease to renew token.

renewable.description: Flag to allow the token to be renewed

ttl.description: The TTL period of the token.

wrapping_ttl.description: The TTL period of the wrapped token.

allowed_policies.description: List of allowed policies for given role.

bound_cidrs.description: List of CIDRs valid as the source address for login requests. This value is also encoded into any resulting token.

disallowed_policies.description: List of disallowed policies for given role.

explicit_max_ttl.description: Number of seconds after which issued tokens can no longer be renewed.

orphan.description: If true, tokens created against this policy will be orphan tokens.

path_suffix.description: Tokens created against this role will have the given suffix as part of their path in addition to the role name.

period.description: Number of seconds to set the TTL to for issued tokens upon renewal. Makes the token a periodic token, which will never expire as long as it is renewed before the TTL each period.

renewable.description: Whether to disable the ability of the token to be renewed past its initial TTL.

alphabet.description: A string of characters that contains the alphabet set.

The mount path for a back-end, for example, the path given in "$ vault auth enable -path=my-aws aws".

transformations.description: A comma separated string or slice of transformations to use.

alphabet.description: The alphabet to use for this template. This is only used during FPE transformations.

path.description: The mount path for a back-end, for example, the path given in "$ vault auth enable -path=my-aws aws".

pattern.description: The pattern used for matching. Currently, only regular expression pattern is supported.

type.description: The pattern type to use for match detection. Currently, only regex is supported.

allowed_roles.description: The set of roles allowed to perform this transformation.

masking_character.description: The character used to replace data when in masking mode

path.description: The mount path for a back-end, for example, the path given in "$ vault auth enable -path=my-aws aws".

template.description: The name of the template to use.

tweak_source.description: The source of where the tweak value comes from. Only valid when in FPE mode.

type.description: The type of transformation to perform.

allow_plaintext_backup.description: If set, enables taking backup of named key in the plaintext format. Once set, this cannot be disabled.

backend.description: The Transit secret backend the resource belongs to.

convergent_encryption.description: Whether or not to support convergent encryption, where the same plaintext creates the same ciphertext. This requires derived to be set to true.

deletion_allowed.description: Specifies if the key is allowed to be deleted.

derived.description: Specifies if key derivation is to be used. If enabled, all encrypt/decrypt requests to this key must provide a context which is used for key derivation.

exportable.description: Enables keys to be exportable. This allows for all the valid keys in the key ring to be exported. Once set, this cannot be disabled.

keys.description: List of key versions in the keyring.

latest_version.description: Latest key version in use in the keyring

min_available_version.description: Minimum key version available for use.

min_decryption_version.description: Minimum key version to use for decryption.

min_encryption_version.description: Minimum key version to use for encryption

name.description: Name of the encryption key to create.

supports_decryption.description: Whether or not the key supports decryption, based on key type.

supports_derivation.description: Whether or not the key supports derivation, based on key type.

supports_encryption.description: Whether or not the key supports encryption, based on key type.

supports_signing.description: Whether or not the key supports signing, based on key type.

type.description: Specifies the type of key to create. The currently-supported types are: aes128-gcm96, aes256-gcm96, chacha20-poly1305, ed25519, ecdsa-p256, ecdsa-p384, ecdsa-p521, rsa-2048, rsa-3072, rsa-4096

backend.description: The Transit secret backend the resource belongs to.

size.description: Number of cache entries. A size of 0 mean unlimited.

accessor.description: The accessor of the auth backend.

description.description: The description of the auth backend.

listing_visibility.description: Specifies whether to show this mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint.

local.description: Specifies if the auth method is local only

type.description: The name of the auth backend.

backend.description: AWS Secret Backend to read credentials from.

lease_duration.description: Lease duration in seconds relative to the time in lease_start_time.

lease_renewable.description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

region.description: Region the read credentials belong to.

role.description: AWS Secret Role to read credentials from.

role_arn.description: ARN to use if multiple are available in the role. Required if the role has multiple ARNs.

secret_key.description: AWS secret key read from Vault.

security_token.description: AWS security token read from Vault. (Only returned if type is 'sts').

type.description: Type of credentials to read. Must be either 'creds' for Access Key and Secret Key, or 'sts' for STS.

backend.description: Azure Secret Backend to read credentials from.

client_id.description: The client id for credentials to query the Azure APIs.

client_secret.description: The client secret for credentials to query the Azure APIs.

lease_renewable.description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

max_cred_validation_seconds.description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of seconds after which to give up validating credentials.

num_seconds_between_tests.description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of seconds to wait between each test of generated credentials.

num_sequential_successes.description: If 'validate_creds' is true, the number of sequential successes required to validate generated credentials.

role.description: Azure Secret Role to read credentials from.

validate_creds.description: Whether generated credentials should be validated before being returned.

data.description: Map of strings read from Vault.

data_json.description: JSON-encoded secret data read from Vault.

lease_renewable.description: True if the duration of this lease can be extended through renewal.

lease_start_time.description: Time at which the lease was read, using the clock of the system where Terraform was running

path.description: Full path from which a secret will be read.

alias_name.description: Name of the alias. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_mount_accessor`.

data_json.description: Entity data from Vault in JSON String form

alias_name.description: Name of the alias. This should be supplied in conjunction with `alias_mount_accessor`.

batch_input.description: Specifies a list of items to be decoded in a single batch. If this parameter is set, the top-level parameters 'value', 'transformation' and 'tweak' will be ignored. Each batch item within the list can specify these parameters instead.

decoded_value.description: The result of decoding a value.

path.description: Path to backend from which to retrieve data.

transformation.description: The transformation to perform. If no value is provided and the role contains a single transformation, this value will be inferred from the role.

tweak.description: The tweak value to use. Only applicable for FPE transformations

value.description: The value in which to decode.

batch_input.description: Specifies a list of items to be encoded in a single batch. If this parameter is set, the parameters 'value', 'transformation' and 'tweak' will be ignored. Each batch item within the list can specify these parameters instead.

encoded_value.description: The result of encoding a value.
